intro: Pelargonium fraternum, commonly known as the Cape sugarleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Pelargonium fraternum thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
